oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Composite of the surviving members of Lieut. General N. B. Forrest's Staff

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Composite photographs; Portrait photographs; Memorial works
Forrest, Nathan Bedford (1821-1877); United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Surviving staff of Lieutenant General Nathan Bedford Forrest's cavalry unit are featured in composite form; oval images of Charles Anderson, J. B. Cowan, George Dashiel, Samuel Donelson, W. M. Forrest, and John W. Morton surround the central photo of Nathan Bedford Forrest. Also listed on the composite are the deceased staff members, and those who served briefly.

Staff officers in the Civil War generally assisted a commander with planning and administrative duties and ensured that command decisions were properly implemented by line officers. In this composite, for example, surgeons, paymasters, quartermasters, and chiefs of engineering, ordnance, and artillery are among those positions mentioned.
